==Japanese==

{{wikipedia|Lapsang souchong}}
[[File:JacksonsLapsangSouchong_low.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|{{PAGENAME}}}} (''rapusan sūchon'', ''seisan shōshu''): loose '''[[lapsang souchong]]''' [[tea]].]]

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
{{borrowing|ja|yue|-|sort=らぷさんすうちょん}} {{m|zh|立山小種|tr=laap<sup>6</sup> saan<sup>1</sup> siu<sup>2</sup> zung<sup>2</sup>|lit=sub-variety from Lapu Mountain}}.

The spelling was apparently changed prior to borrowing into Japanese, replacing the {{m|zh|立|tr=laap<sup>6</sup>}} character with the {{m|zh|正|tr=zeng<sup>3</sup>}} character while keeping the pronunciation unchanged.

The reading is an approximation of modern {{etyl|yue|-}}, and is thus neither [[音読み#Japanese|on'yomi]] nor [[訓読み#Japanese|kun'yomi]].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|ラプサン スーチョン}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|ラプサン・スーチョン}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ラプサン・スーチョン}}

# [[lapsang souchong]] [[tea]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading appears to be the most common.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=on|せい|さん|しょう|しゅ}}
The spelling is a {{borrowing|ja|nocap=1|zh|sort=せいさんしょうしゅ|正山小種}}. The reading is the expected [[音読み#Japanese|on'yomi]] for these characters.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|せいさん しょうしゅ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|せいさん しょうしゅ}}

# [[lapsang souchong]] [[tea]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading appears to be substantially less common than ''rapusan sūchon'' above. However, it is also the most obvious reading from a Japanese perspective, using the standard Japanese pronunciation of the characters.
